name: markdown-cv
tagline: a simple template to write your CV in a readable markdown file and use CSS to publish/print it.
body:
# markdown-cv

_Tired of using LaTeX to make your CV look pretty? Can't remember how to set margins in your TeX file? Refusing to compromise and use Word?_

Meet **markdown-cv**, a simple template to list all your accomplishments in a readable [Markdown](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/) file and use CSS to style it. 

To start, simply fork the repository and type your skills, jobs and education in the `index.md` file. 

Then let your local installation of [jekyll](http://jekyllrb.com) or [GitHub Pages](https://pages.github.com) do the work of transforming your plain text CV into a beautiful looking HTML page.

Print and web [CSS media queries](http://www.alistapart.com/articles/goingtoprint/) mean that to get a PDF you can just press print in your favourite browser.

***

The included CSS renders CV in a style inspired by [kjhealy's vita template](http://kjhealy.github.com/kjh-vita/), but any styling is possible. Contributions and forks are welcome!
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
